intro: Siphocampylus duploserratus, commonly known as the double-toothed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue-purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and grows in rocky or alpine environments. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflowers. Siphocampylus duploserratus is typically found at high elevations and is adapted to cold, dry climates.
